sn34.13:1.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ kallitakusalo.
sn34.13:1.4.eng: One meditator is skilled in entering immersion but not in positivity for immersion. …”

sn34.13:1.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ kallitakusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo.

sn34.13:1.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī neva samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo hoti, na ca samādhismiṃ kallitakusalo.

sn34.13:1.7.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo ca hoti, samādhismiṃ kallitakusalo ca.

sn34.14:1.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ ārammaṇakusalo.
sn34.14:1.4.eng: One meditator is skilled in entering immersion but not in the supports for it. …”

sn34.14:1.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ ārammaṇakusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo.

sn34.14:1.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī neva samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo hoti, na ca samādhismiṃ ārammaṇakusalo.

sn34.14:1.7.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo ca hoti, samādhismiṃ ārammaṇakusalo ca.

sn34.15:1.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ gocarakusalo.
sn34.15:1.4.eng: One meditator is skilled in entering immersion but not in the territory of immersion. …”

sn34.15:1.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ gocarakusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo.

sn34.15:1.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī neva samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo hoti, na ca samādhismiṃ gocarakusalo.

sn34.15:1.7.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo ca hoti, samādhismiṃ gocarakusalo ca.

sn34.16:1.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ abhinīhārakusalo.
sn34.16:1.4.eng: One meditator is skilled in entering immersion but not in projecting the mind purified by immersion. …”

sn34.16:1.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ abhinīhārakusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo.

sn34.16:1.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī neva samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo hoti, na ca samādhismiṃ abhinīhārakusalo.

sn34.16:1.7.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo ca hoti, samādhismiṃ abhinīhārakusalo ca.

sn34.17:1.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ sakkaccakārī.
sn34.17:1.4.eng: One meditator is skilled in entering immersion but not in practicing carefully for it. …”

sn34.17:1.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ sakkaccakārī hoti, na samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo.

sn34.17:1.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī neva samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo hoti, na ca samādhismiṃ sakkaccakārī.

sn34.17:1.7.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo ca hoti, samādhismiṃ sakkaccakārī ca.

sn34.18:1.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ sātaccakārī.
sn34.18:1.4.eng: One meditator is skilled in entering immersion but not in practicing persistently for it. …”

sn34.18:1.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ sātaccakārī hoti, na samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo.

sn34.18:1.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī neva samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo hoti, na ca samādhismiṃ sātaccakārī.

sn34.18:1.7.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo ca hoti, samādhismiṃ sātaccakārī ca.

sn34.19:1.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ sappāyakārī.
sn34.19:1.4.eng: One meditator is skilled in entering immersion but not in doing what’s conducive to it. …”

sn34.19:1.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ sappāyakārī hoti, na samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo.

sn34.19:1.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī neva samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo hoti, na ca samādhismiṃ sappāyakārī.

sn34.19:1.7.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo ca hoti, samādhismiṃ sappāyakārī ca.

sn34.19:1.8.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ jhāyī samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo ca hoti samādhismiṃ sappāyakārī ca ayaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ jhāyīnaṃ aggo ca seṭṭho ca mokkho ca uttamo ca pavaro ca.

sn34.19:1.9.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, gavā khīraṃ, khīramhā dadhi, dadhimhā navanītaṃ, navanītamhā sappi, sappimhā sappimaṇḍo tatra aggamakkhāyati;

sn34.19:1.10.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ jhāyī samādhismiṃ samāpattikusalo ca hoti samādhismiṃ sappāyakārī ca ayaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ jhāyīnaṃ aggo ca seṭṭho ca mokkho ca uttamo ca pavaro cā”ti.

sn34.2:1.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ ṭhitikusalo.
sn34.2:1.4.eng: One meditator is skilled in immersion but not in remaining in it.
sn34.2:1.4.comm: They cannot stay long, or determine the length of the absorbed state.

sn34.2:1.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ ṭhitikusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo.
sn34.2:1.5.eng: One meditator is skilled in remaining in immersion but is not skilled in immersion.

sn34.2:1.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī neva samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo hoti, na ca samādhismiṃ ṭhitikusalo.
sn34.2:1.6.eng: One meditator is skilled neither in immersion nor in remaining in it.

sn34.2:1.7.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo ca hoti, samādhismiṃ ṭhitikusalo ca.
sn34.2:1.7.eng: One meditator is skilled both in immersion and in remaining in it.

sn34.2:1.8.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo ca hoti samādhismiṃ ṭhitikusalo ca ayaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ jhāyīnaṃ aggo ca seṭṭho ca mokkho ca uttamo ca pavaro ca.
sn34.2:1.8.eng: Of these, the meditator skilled in immersion and in remaining in it is the foremost, best, leading, highest, and finest of the four.

sn34.2:1.9.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, gavā khīraṃ, khīramhā dadhi, dadhimhā navanītaṃ, navanītamhā sappi, sappimhā sappimaṇḍo tatra aggamakkhāyati;
sn34.2:1.9.eng: From a cow comes milk, from milk comes curds, from curds come butter, from butter comes ghee, and from ghee comes cream of ghee. And the cream of ghee is said to be the best of these.

sn34.2:1.10.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo ca hoti samādhismiṃ ṭhitikusalo ca ayaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ jhāyīnaṃ aggo ca seṭṭho ca mokkho ca uttamo ca pavaro cā”ti.
sn34.2:1.10.eng: In the same way, the meditator skilled in immersion and remaining in it is the foremost, best, leading, highest, and finest of the four.”

sn34.20-27:0.3.eng: Eight on Remaining and Emergence, Etc.

sn34.20-27:1.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ ṭhitikusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ vuṭṭhānakusalo.
sn34.20-27:1.4.eng: One meditator is skilled in remaining in immersion but not in emerging from it. …”

sn34.20-27:1.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ vuṭṭhānakusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ ṭhitikusalo.

sn34.20-27:1.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī neva samādhismiṃ ṭhitikusalo hoti, na ca samādhismiṃ vuṭṭhānakusalo.

sn34.20-27:1.7.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ ṭhitikusalo ca hoti, samādhismiṃ vuṭṭhānakusalo ca.

sn34.20-27:1.11.pli: (Purimamūlakāni viya yāva sattavīsatimā ṭhitimūlakasappāyakārīsuttā aṭṭha suttāni pūretabbāni.)
sn34.20-27:1.11.eng: (These eight discourses should be told in full as the previous set.)

sn34.28-34:0.3.eng: Seven on Emergence and Gladdening, Etc.

sn34.28-34:1.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ vuṭṭhānakusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ kallitakusalo …
sn34.28-34:1.4.eng: One meditator is skilled in emerging from immersion but not in positivity for immersion. …”

sn34.28-34:1.5.pli: samādhismiṃ kallitakusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ vuṭṭhānakusalo …

sn34.28-34:1.6.pli: neva samādhismiṃ vuṭṭhānakusalo hoti, na ca samādhismiṃ kallitakusalo …

sn34.28-34:1.7.pli: samādhismiṃ vuṭṭhānakusalo ca hoti samādhismiṃ kallitakusalo ca.

sn34.28-34:1.11.pli: (Purimamūlakāni viya yāva catuttiṃsatimā vuṭṭhānamūlakasappāyakārīsuttā satta suttāni pūretabbāni.)
sn34.28-34:1.11.eng: (These seven discourses should be told in full as the previous set.)

sn34.3:1.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ vuṭṭhānakusalo.
sn34.3:1.4.eng: One meditator is skilled in immersion but not in emerging from it. …”
sn34.3:1.4.comm: They cannot determine the time for emerging from the meditation.

sn34.3:1.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ vuṭṭhānakusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo.

sn34.3:1.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī neva samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo hoti, na ca samādhismiṃ vuṭṭhānakusalo.

sn34.3:1.7.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo ca hoti, samādhismiṃ vuṭṭhānakusalo ca.

sn34.3:1.8.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo ca hoti samādhismiṃ vuṭṭhānakusalo ca ayaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ jhāyīnaṃ aggo ca seṭṭho ca mokkho ca uttamo ca pavaro ca.

sn34.35-40:0.3.eng: Six on Gladdening and Support, Etc.

sn34.35-40:1.2.eng: “One meditator is skilled in positivity for immersion but not in the supports for immersion. …”

sn34.35-40:1.3.pli: samādhismiṃ ārammaṇakusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ kallitakusalo …

sn34.35-40:1.4.pli: neva samādhismiṃ kallitakusalo hoti, na ca samādhismiṃ ārammaṇakusalo …

sn34.35-40:1.5.pli: samādhismiṃ kallitakusalo ca hoti, samādhismiṃ ārammaṇakusalo ca.

sn34.35-40:1.9.pli: (Purimamūlakāni viya yāva cattālīsamā kallitamūlakasappāyakārīsuttā cha suttāni pūretabbāni.)
sn34.35-40:1.9.eng: (These six discourses should be told in full as the previous set.)

sn34.4:1.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ kallitakusalo.
sn34.4:1.4.eng: One meditator is skilled in immersion but not in positivity for immersion. …”
sn34.4:1.4.comm: Kallita means “healthy and happy, well-disposed”, and is explained by the commentary as “gladdening the mind”. Any meditator knows that there are ups and downs in the process, and it is essential to keep the mind balanced, with a positive attitude.

sn34.4:1.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ kallitakusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo.

sn34.4:1.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī neva samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo hoti, na ca samādhismiṃ kallitakusalo.

sn34.4:1.7.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo ca hoti, samādhismiṃ kallitakusalo ca.

sn34.4:1.8.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo ca hoti samādhismiṃ kallitakusalo ca ayaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ jhāyīnaṃ aggo ca seṭṭho ca mokkho ca uttamo ca pavaro ca.

sn34.41-45:0.3.eng: Five on Support and Territory, Etc.

sn34.41-45:1.2.eng: “One meditator is skilled in the supports for immersion but not in the territory of immersion. …”

sn34.41-45:1.3.pli: samādhismiṃ gocarakusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ ārammaṇakusalo …

sn34.41-45:1.4.pli: neva samādhismiṃ ārammaṇakusalo hoti, na ca samādhismiṃ gocarakusalo …

sn34.41-45:1.5.pli: samādhismiṃ ārammaṇakusalo ca hoti, samādhismiṃ gocarakusalo ca.

sn34.41-45:1.9.pli: (Purimamūlakāni viya yāva pañcacattālīsamā ārammaṇamūlakasappāyakārīsuttā pañca suttāni pūretabbāni.)
sn34.41-45:1.9.eng: (These five discourses should be told in full as the previous set.)

sn34.46:0.3.eng: Four on Territory and Projection, Etc.

sn34.46:1.2.eng: “One meditator is skilled in the territory of immersion but not in projecting the mind purified by immersion. …”

sn34.46:1.3.pli: samādhismiṃ abhinīhārakusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ gocarakusalo …

sn34.46:1.4.pli: neva samādhismiṃ gocarakusalo hoti, na ca samādhismiṃ abhinīhārakusalo …

sn34.46:1.5.pli: samādhismiṃ gocarakusalo ca hoti, samādhismiṃ abhinīhārakusalo ca …

sn34.46:1.6.pli: seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, gavā khīraṃ, khīramhā dadhi, dadhimhā navanītaṃ, navanītamhā sappi, sappimhā sappimaṇḍo tatra aggamakkhāyati;

sn34.46:1.7.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ jhāyī samādhismiṃ gocarakusalo ca hoti samādhismiṃ abhinīhārakusalo ca ayaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ jhāyīnaṃ …pe…

sn34.47:1.1.eng: “One meditator is skilled in the territory of immersion but not in practicing carefully for it. …”

sn34.47:1.2.eng: (These four discourses should be told in full as the previous set.)

sn34.48:1.1.eng: “One meditator is skilled in the territory of immersion but not in practicing persistently for it. …”

sn34.49:1.1.eng: “One meditator is skilled in the territory of immersion but not in doing what’s conducive to it. …”

sn34.5:1.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ ārammaṇakusalo.
sn34.5:1.4.eng: One meditator is skilled in immersion but not in the supports for immersion. …”
sn34.5:1.4.comm: “Support” is ārammaṇa, namely the different subjects of meditation. This is the only term in this list that does not appear elsewhere in the early canon. It does not mean “object”, which is exclusively a later sense, derived from the (again later) use of the kasiṇa as a physical “object” or “disk” on which to focus attention (for the Sutta usage, see MN 77:24.11). An “object” is something that has an “objective” reality independent of the observer. But for the Suttas, meditations like the breath, or love, or an inner reflection on mortality are dimensions of living experience that change and grow through and with the course of meditation. The meditation subject is not something at which the mind is directed, it is something with which the mind grows.

sn34.5:1.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ ārammaṇakusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo.

sn34.5:1.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī neva samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo hoti, na ca samādhismiṃ ārammaṇakusalo.

sn34.5:1.7.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo ca hoti, samādhismiṃ ārammaṇakusalo ca.

sn34.5:1.8.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo ca hoti samādhismiṃ ārammaṇakusalo ca ayaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ jhāyīnaṃ aggo ca seṭṭho ca mokkho ca uttamo ca pavaro ca.

sn34.50:1.2.eng: “One meditator is skilled in projecting the mind purified by immersion but not in practicing carefully for it. …”

sn34.50:1.3.pli: samādhismiṃ sakkaccakārī hoti, na samādhismiṃ abhinīhārakusalo …

sn34.50:1.4.pli: neva samādhismiṃ abhinīhārakusalo hoti, na ca samādhismiṃ sakkaccakārī …

sn34.50:1.5.pli: samādhismiṃ abhinīhārakusalo ca hoti, samādhismiṃ sakkaccakārī ca.

sn34.51:1.1.eng: “One meditator is skilled in projecting the mind purified by immersion but not in practicing persistently for it. …”

sn34.52:1.1.eng: “One meditator is skilled in projecting the mind purified by immersion but not in doing what’s conducive to it. …”

sn34.53:1.2.eng: “One meditator is skilled in practicing carefully for immersion but not in practicing persistently for it. …”

sn34.53:1.3.pli: samādhismiṃ sātaccakārī hoti, na samādhismiṃ sakkaccakārī …

sn34.53:1.4.pli: neva samādhismiṃ sakkaccakārī hoti, na ca samādhismiṃ sātaccakārī …

sn34.53:1.5.pli: samādhismiṃ sakkaccakārī ca hoti, samādhismiṃ sātaccakārī ca.

sn34.54:1.1.eng: “One meditator is skilled in practicing carefully for immersion but not in doing what’s conducive to it. …”

sn34.55:1.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ sātaccakārī hoti, na samādhismiṃ sappāyakārī.
sn34.55:1.4.eng: One meditator is skilled in practicing persistently for immersion but not in doing what’s conducive to it.

sn34.55:1.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ sappāyakārī hoti, na samādhismiṃ sātaccakārī.
sn34.55:1.5.eng: One meditator is skilled in doing what’s conducive to immersion but not in practicing persistently for it.

sn34.55:1.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī neva samādhismiṃ sātaccakārī hoti, na ca samādhismiṃ sappāyakārī.
sn34.55:1.6.eng: One meditator is skilled neither in practicing persistently for immersion nor in doing what’s conducive to it.

sn34.55:1.7.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ sātaccakārī ca hoti, samādhismiṃ sappāyakārī ca.
sn34.55:1.7.eng: One meditator is skilled both in practicing persistently for immersion and in doing what’s conducive to it.

sn34.55:1.8.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ jhāyī samādhismiṃ sātaccakārī ca hoti samādhismiṃ sappāyakārī ca ayaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ jhāyīnaṃ aggo ca seṭṭho ca mokkho ca uttamo ca pavaro ca.
sn34.55:1.8.eng: Of these, the meditator skilled both in practicing persistently for immersion and in doing what’s conducive to it is the foremost, best, leading, highest, and finest of the four.

sn34.55:1.9.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, gavā khīraṃ, khīramhā dadhi, dadhimhā navanītaṃ, navanītamhā sappi, sappimhā sappimaṇḍo tatra aggamakkhāyati;
sn34.55:1.9.eng: From a cow comes milk, from milk comes curds, from curds come butter, from butter comes ghee, and from ghee comes cream of ghee. And the cream of ghee is said to be the best of these.

sn34.55:1.10.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ jhāyī samādhismiṃ sātaccakārī ca hoti, samādhismiṃ sappāyakārī ca ayaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ jhāyīnaṃ aggo ca seṭṭho ca mokkho ca uttamo ca pavaro cā”ti.
sn34.55:1.10.eng: In the same way, the meditator skilled both in practicing persistently for immersion and in doing what’s conducive to it is the foremost, best, leading, highest, and finest of the four.”

sn34.55:1.11.eng: That is what the Buddha said.

sn34.55:1.12.pli: Attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinandunti.
sn34.55:1.12.eng: Satisfied, the mendicants approved what the Buddha said.

sn34.55:1.14.eng: (All should be told in full as per the fifty-fifth discourse.)

sn34.55:2.5.eng: The Linked Discourses on Absorption are complete.

sn34.55:3.7.eng: The Book of the Aggregates is finished.

sn34.6:1.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ gocarakusalo.
sn34.6:1.4.eng: One meditator is skilled in immersion but not in the territory of immersion. …”
sn34.6:1.4.comm: A gocara (“territory”) is literally the “cowpasture” and figuratively the “proper resort” or “territory”. At SN 47.6, a meditator’s “territory” is said to be the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.

sn34.6:1.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ gocarakusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo.

sn34.6:1.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī neva samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo hoti, na ca samādhismiṃ gocarakusalo.

sn34.6:1.7.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo ca hoti, samādhismiṃ gocarakusalo ca.

sn34.6:1.8.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo ca hoti samādhismiṃ gocarakusalo ca ayaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ jhāyīnaṃ aggo ca seṭṭho ca mokkho ca uttamo ca pavaro ca.

sn34.7:0.3.eng: Projecting the Mind Purified by Immersion

sn34.7:1.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ abhinīhārakusalo.
sn34.7:1.4.eng: One meditator is skilled in immersion but not in projecting the mind purified by immersion. …”
sn34.7:1.4.comm: They cannot “project” the mind to the various psychic powers and higher knowledges (DN 2:84.6).

sn34.7:1.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ abhinīhārakusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo.

sn34.7:1.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī neva samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo hoti, na ca samādhismiṃ abhinīhārakusalo.

sn34.7:1.7.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo ca hoti, samādhismiṃ abhinīhārakusalo ca.

sn34.7:1.8.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo ca hoti samādhismiṃ abhinīhārakusalo ca ayaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ jhāyīnaṃ aggo ca seṭṭho ca mokkho ca uttamo ca pavaro ca.

sn34.8:1.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ sakkaccakārī.
sn34.8:1.4.eng: One meditator is skilled in immersion but not in practicing carefully for it. …”
sn34.8:1.4.comm: They cannot maintain a systematic practice throughout the day (AN 3.19:2.3).

sn34.8:1.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ sakkaccakārī hoti, na samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo.

sn34.8:1.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī neva samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo hoti, na ca samādhismiṃ sakkaccakārī.

sn34.8:1.7.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo ca hoti, samādhismiṃ sakkaccakārī ca.

sn34.8:1.8.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo ca hoti samādhismiṃ sakkaccakārī ca ayaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ jhāyīnaṃ aggo ca seṭṭho ca mokkho ca uttamo ca pavaro ca.

sn34.9:1.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo hoti, na samādhismiṃ sātaccakārī.
sn34.9:1.4.eng: One meditator is skilled in immersion but not in practicing persistently for it. …”
sn34.9:1.4.comm: The failure of “persistence” in a meditator is often linked with their emotional hard-heartedness and mental shackles (MN 16:3.1). Without a faithful, kind, and wholesome disposition it is difficult to sustain a meditation practice.

sn34.9:1.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ sātaccakārī hoti, na samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo.

sn34.9:1.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī neva samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo hoti, na ca samādhismiṃ sātaccakārī.

sn34.9:1.7.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo ca hoti, samādhismiṃ sātaccakārī ca.

sn34.9:1.8.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yvāyaṃ jhāyī samādhismiṃ samādhikusalo ca hoti, samādhismiṃ sātaccakārī ca ayaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ jhāyīnaṃ aggo ca seṭṭho ca mokkho ca uttamo ca pavaro ca.
